title: AI is doing up to 50% of the work at Salesforce, CEO Marc Benioff says
original_content: Key Points Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff said artificial intelligence is accounting for 30% to 50% of the company's workload. Technology companies are hunting for new ways to trim costs, boost efficiencies and transform their workforce with the help of AI. Benioff estimates that the software company has reached about 93% accuracy with the technology. In this article CRM Follow your favorite stocks CREATE FREE ACCOUNT Marc Benioff, Chairman & CEO of Salesforce, speaking on CNBC's Squawk Box outside the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland on Jan. 22nd, 2025. Gerry Miller | CNBC Salesforce is accelerating its use of artificial intelligence in automating workloads, according to CEO Marc Benioff . "All of us have to get our head around this idea that AI could do things, that before, we were doing, and we can move on to do higher-value work," he said in an interview with Bloomberg , noting that the technology currently accounts for about 30% to 50% of the company's work. Technology companies are hunting for new ways to trim costs, boost efficiencies and transform their workforce with the help of AI. The aftershocks have already hit the tech industry, with the software giant cutting more than 1,000 positions earlier this year as it restructured around AI. Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski said the company has shrunk its headcount by 40% due in part to AI investment, while Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said the e-commerce giant will use artificial intelligence to reduce roles. Benioff called the rise of AI in the workforce a "digital labor revolution," estimating that the software company has reached about 93% accuracy with the technology. "It's pretty good," he said, but it's not "realistic" to hit 100%. He added that other vendors are at "much lower levels because they don't have as much data and metadata" to build higher accuracy. tiktok_summary: The innovation that's rewriting all the rules: Marc Benioff, the CEO of Salesforce, just dropped some major tea on the future of work. According to him, AI is taking over a whopping 30 to 50% of his team's workload. That's right, folks, automation is no longer just a buzzword – it's a reality. Technology companies are getting creative with AI to cut costs, boost efficiency, and transform their workforce. And Salesforce is leading the charge. The company has reached an impressive 93% accuracy with its AI tools, which is insane. But here's where things get really spicy: Benioff believes that AI will soon make many jobs obsolete. He thinks humans will need to adapt and focus on higher-value tasks, leaving the mundane work to machines. Talk about a paradigm shift! Wait, what? You might be thinking... if AI is so powerful, why haven't we seen more widespread adoption yet? Well, according to the CEO, it's because most companies aren't using AI correctly. They're treating it as a silver bullet, rather than a strategic tool to drive business growth. That's a problem. Because when used improperly, AI can lead to significant losses. But when harnessed properly, it can be a game-changer. Benioff's vision for Salesforce is one of a future where humans and machines collaborate seamlessly, creating a symphony of productivity. Think about it: with AI handling the grunt work, humans can focus on creative problem-solving, innovation, and strategy. It's a beautiful thing. But don't get too comfortable – Benioff warns that this won't happen overnight. It'll take time, effort, and a willingness to adapt.
